page.title: 10Plas Thomas farm, Ellesmere
page.content: Plas Thomas is a very large dairy farm. It is one hundred and fifty one acres and eighteen of it is woodland. Milk is produced on this farm and it is sold to the Milk Marketing Board, who collect it. A family own the farm and the workers are a father and two sons. All the cattle are Ayrshires, one hundred are cows, fifty are replacement rearing and sixty are beef cattle. Most of the land is used for grazing the cattle and for silage. The farm make their own silage. The farm was built in the 15th century. The machines they use are tractors, mowers, ploughs, silagers and a forage box. The wildlife found on the farm are foxes, badgers and grey squirrels. The farmhouse looks much older than the other farm buildings, which are barns, storage garages and cow stalls.
